Token.Abstract: * description: A pyramid series. If the type option is not specified, it is inherited from chart.type. For options that apply to multiple series, it is recommended to add them to the plotOptions.series options structure. To apply to all series of this specific type, apply it to plotOptions. pyramid.
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic.
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic.
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic.
* description: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size. * default: 80
* description: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size. * default: 80
* description: The minimum size for a pie in response to auto margins. The pie will try to shrink to make room for data labels in side the plot area, but only to this size. * default: 80

* description: Equivalent to chart.ignoreHiddenSeries, this option tells whether the series shall be redrawn as if the hidden point were null. The default value changed from false to true with Highcharts 3.0.

* description: Equivalent to chart.ignoreHiddenSeries, this option tells whether the series shall be redrawn as if the hidden point were null. The default value changed from false to true with Highcharts 3.0.

* description: Equivalent to chart.ignoreHiddenSeries, this option tells whether the series shall be redrawn as if the hidden point were null. The default value changed from false to true with Highcharts 3.0.
* description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number. * default: 90%
* description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number. * default: 90%
* description: The width of the funnel compared to the width of the plot area, or the pixel width if it is a number. * default: 90%

* description: The size of the inner diameter for the pie. A size greater than 0 renders a donut chart. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Percentages are relative to the pie size. Pixel values are given as integers. Note: in Highcharts < 4.1.2, the percentage was relative to the plot area, not the pie size.

* description: The size of the inner diameter for the pie. A size greater than 0 renders a donut chart. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Percentages are relative to the pie size. Pixel values are given as integers. Note: in Highcharts < 4.1.2, the percentage was relative to the plot area, not the pie size.

* description: The size of the inner diameter for the pie. A size greater than 0 renders a donut chart. Can be a percentage or pixel value. Percentages are relative to the pie size. Pixel values are given as integers. Note: in Highcharts < 4.1.2, the percentage was relative to the plot area, not the pie size.
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic. * default: 0%
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic. * default: 0%
* description: The pyramid neck width is zero by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the same layout logic. * default: 0%
description: The thickness of a 3D pie. Requires highcharts-3d.js default: 0
description: The thickness of a 3D pie. Requires highcharts-3d.js default: 0
description: The thickness of a 3D pie. Requires highcharts-3d.js default: 0
* description: The pyramid is reversed by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the layout engine, and is not reversed. * default: true
* description: The pyramid is reversed by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the layout engine, and is not reversed. * default: true
* description: The pyramid is reversed by default, as opposed to the funnel, which shares the layout engine, and is not reversed. * default: true
* description: The end angle of the pie in degrees where 0 is top and 90 is right. Defaults to startAngle plus 360.
* description: The end angle of the pie in degrees where 0 is top and 90 is right. Defaults to startAngle plus 360.
* description: The end angle of the pie in degrees where 0 is top and 90 is right. Defaults to startAngle plus 360.
* description: The start angle of the pie slices in degrees where 0 is top and 90 right.
* description: The start angle of the pie slices in degrees where 0 is top and 90 right.
* description: The start angle of the pie slices in degrees where 0 is top and 90 right.
* description: The height of the funnel or pyramid. If it is a number it defines the pixel height, if it is a percentage string it is the percentage of the plot area height.
* description: The height of the funnel or pyramid. If it is a number it defines the pixel height, if it is a percentage string it is the percentage of the plot area height.
* description: The height of the funnel or pyramid. If it is a number it defines the pixel height, if it is a percentage string it is the percentage of the plot area height.
* description: The center of the series. By default, it is centered in the middle of the plot area, so it fills the plot area height.
* description: The center of the series. By default, it is centered in the middle of the plot area, so it fills the plot area height.
* description: The center of the series. By default, it is centered in the middle of the plot area, so it fills the plot area height.
* description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?.
* description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?.
* description: If a point is sliced, moved out from the center, how many pixels should it be moved?.

* description: The color of the border surrounding each slice. When null, the border takes the same color as the slice fill. This can be used together with a borderWidth to fill drawing gaps created by antialiazing artefacts in borderless pies. In styled mode, the border stroke is given in the .highcharts-point class.

* description: The color of the border surrounding each slice. When null, the border takes the same color as the slice fill. This can be used together with a borderWidth to fill drawing gaps created by antialiazing artefacts in borderless pies. In styled mode, the border stroke is given in the .highcharts-point class.

* description: The color of the border surrounding each slice. When null, the border takes the same color as the slice fill. This can be used together with a borderWidth to fill drawing gaps created by antialiazing artefacts in borderless pies. In styled mode, the border stroke is given in the .highcharts-point class.
* description: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.
* description: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.
* description: A series specific or series type specific color set to use instead of the global colors.
